results.title: Footy chicks
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Red Ithaka Productions, SBS Independent, Michaela Perske and Rebecca Barry
results.brief_description: Many Australians love their football; many Australian women also desire the men who play it. Michaela Perske and Rebecca Barry have made a hard-hitting documentary that uses a combination of interviews, observational filming and stylised re-enactments to examine some of the interactions between football players and “Footy Chicks”. In the early 21st century, Australia saw a number of allegations of sexual assaults on women made against football players and clubs from both the Rugby League and AFL codes. Against this background, “Footy Chicks” explores the gender and sexual power relationships, and the attitudes of both players and women to the fun and the dangers involved in the sexual culture of Australian football. As well as the players and “footy chicks” who speak for themselves, interviewees include Kath Haines from Footy Fans Against Sexual Assault; Dr Clifton Evers, Lecturer in Gender Studies; Dr Catharine Lumby, Associate Professor Media Studies, and Karen Willis from the New South Wales Rape Crisis Centre.

results.title: Footscray 1911
results.brief_description: Scenes of Footscray around 1911. Shows street scenes, transport, recreation and clothing. Recognizable scenes include Nicholson Street and Forges Store. Footscray Railway Station and Federal Hall.

results.title: Footrot Flats - the Dogs Tail Tale
results.creator_credit: John Barnett, Paul Cox and Murray Bell
results.brief_description: This is the dog’s tale: his first encounter with the sexy bitch Jess; his loyal devotion to Wal Footrot, whom he saves from a fate worse than death; his adventures with Horse, the cat with the barracuda jaw and fishhook claws; his brilliant cowardice and mighty nose, pitted against the dastardly schemes of the villainous Murphys, their hell hounds, and the croco pigs. Based on the comic strip of the same name.

results.title: Footprint of the Buddha
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this episode Ronald Eyre visits a buddhist monastery in Sri Lanka to discover the meaning of buddhism. He finds that buddhism has no god; buddhists regard gods as useful but not crucial. The three basic principles of buddhism are to shun all evils, to do good, and to achieve purification of the mind. The individual can expect no external help, but must follow the noble eight-fold path to nirvana, using meditation to penetrate appearances and show the world as it is. The program includes the initiation of a young boy as a monk.

results.title: Footnotes to a war
results.creator_credit: United Nations Films and Simone Di Bagno
results.brief_description: By focusing on three refugees from Southeast Asia - a former soldier turned medic, a child, and a young woman - this film highlights some of the problems of resettlement and ensuing loss of cultural identity. Narrated by Lu Yu. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Footloose
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Lewis Rachmil, Craig Zadan and Herbert Ross
results.brief_description: Ren MacCormack (Kevin Bacon) moves to Bomont, a small Midwestern town with his mother (Frances Lee McCain). The town is autocratically run by the local minister, Reverend Shaw Moore (John Lithgow). A fatal car accident has caused the reverend to prohibit music, because of the corruptive influence it has over teenagers. His daughter Ariel (Lori Singer) is opposed to her father’s views and is drawn to Ren because of his life in another place where music isn’t banned, and for the possibility that he could take her away from Bomont. Ren pushes the boundaries of the Bomont community when he tries to convince the council to allow them to have a dance. Features a great soundtrack with songs from Kenny Loggins and Bonnie Tyler.

results.title: Footlight parade
results.creator_credit: Lloyd Bacon, Warner Bros Pictures and Robert Lord
results.brief_description: Set against the backdrop of Hollywood in the 1930’s, James Cagney stars as a Broadway musical comedy producer/director who finds himself without a job due to the arrival of talkies. He devises an inventive way of keeping the loan sharks at bay, by creating prologues that can precede the talkies themselves, riding on the coat tails of the very thing that put him out of business in the first place. The comedy and drama of the film is derived from the activities of the players who are part of Cagney’s troupe producing the prologues. There’s the gold digger (Claire Dodd), the disgruntled ex-wife (Renee Whitney), the secretary with secret artistic abilities (Ruby Keeler), the faithful Girl Friday (Joan Blondell) who stands by the man who doesn’t know that she loves him, the long suffering personal assistant (Hugh Herbert), and the young protegee (Dick Powell). Numbers created and staged by Busby Berkeley and include hits such as “Honeymoon hotel”, “Shanghai Lil” and “By a waterfall”. This was the third of Warner’s backstage musicals released in 1933, the other two being “42nd Street” and “The Gold diggers of 1933”.

results.title: Foothold on Antarctica
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures, British Information Services and James Carr
results.brief_description: As a preliminary to the crossing of the Antarctic continent by Sir Vivian Fuchs and his party, an advance group set out from London in the m.v. “Theron”, a Canadian sealing vessel, to establish a base camp. Her month long struggle with the pack ice of the Weddell Sea captured the attention of the world. This film, a record of that journey, received Honourable Mention at the International Festival of Documentary and Expeprimental Cinema, Montevideo, 1958.

results.title: Football: the sport of millions
results.brief_description: Football (soccer) is a peoples sport in the German Republic. Each weekend some 1.5 million spectators attend the games, and there are over 700,000 players in the 64,000 teams. 500,000 of these are juveniles playing in junior teams being trained in special training courses and schools.
